import Prerequisites from '@site/src/components/Prerequisites'; import LearningObjective from '@site/src/components/LearningObjective'; import Outcome from '@site/src/components/Outcome'; import SuccessCriteria from '@site/src/components/SuccessCriteria'; import Exercise from '@site/src/components/Exercise'; import Checkpoint from '@site/src/components/Checkpoint'; Capstone Project: The Autonomous Humanoid This capstone project is your opportunity to bring together everything you have learned in this textbook to build a complete autonomous humanoid robot.

You should have completed all the previous chapters and exercises in this textbook.
  • Apply the concepts learned throughout the textbook to a large-scale project.
  • Gain experience in system integration and debugging.
  • Develop a complete, autonomous robotics application from scratch.
 Project Goal The goal of this project is to build and program a simulated humanoid robot that can: 1. Navigate autonomously in a cluttered indoor environment. 2. Perceive objects in its environment. 3. Pick up a specified object. 4. Place the object at a specified location. Project Phases This project is divided into four phases: Phase 1: Robot Design and Simulation In this phase, you will design the URDF model for your humanoid robot and create a Gazebo world for it to live in. Your robot should have at least two arms with grippers, a head with a camera, and a mobile base. Phase 2: Navigation In this phase, you will integrate the Nav2 stack to give your robot the ability to navigate autonomously. You will need to configure the costmaps, planners, and controllers for a humanoid robot. Phase 3: Perception In this phase, you will add a perception system to your robot. This will involve using a pre-trained object detection model to identify objects in the camera feed. Phase 4: Manipulation In this phase, you will use MoveIt to control the robot's arms. You will write a script that uses the output of your perception system to plan and execute a pick-and-place task.

What are the four main phases of the capstone project?

This entire project is an exercise! Good luck!
